definition: bright and multicolored/of rich variety/(fig.) dazzling/glitzy

sentences.english: Light finds her treasure of colours through the antagonism of clouds.
sentences.chinese: 光线在与云霓的抗衡中觅到了她五光十色的珍宝。

sentences.english: He likes the night scenes with some colorful light around the river and some buskers singing or dancing on the river bank.
sentences.chinese: 他喜欢夜间爱河畔那五光十色与街灯五彩缤纷的景色。

sentences.english: The colorful bright lanterns light up the night.
sentences.chinese: 五光十色的灯笼照亮了漆黑的夜晚。

sentences.english: He writes in glorious technicolor to give you the full effect.
sentences.chinese: 他以五光十色绚丽夺目的文章给你完全的效果。

sentences.english: The panorama of colour and action which fills the world is taken for granted.
sentences.chinese: 大千世界的五光十色与千姿百态被认为是理所当然。

sentences.english: He likes the night scenes with some colorful light around the river and some busk ers singing or dancing on the river bank.
sentences.chinese: 他喜欢夜间爱河畔那五光十色与街灯五彩缤纷的景色。

sentences.english: You look stylish in hats of all kinds, from berets to panamas .
sentences.chinese: 你希望用这种带色彩的镜片记录自己五光十色的生活。

definition: all the colors in profusion (idiom); a garish display
lit. flowing light and overflowing color/brilliant lights and vibrant colors (idiom)
all the colors in profusion (idiom); a garish display
see 五彩繽紛|五彩缤纷[wu3 cai3 bin1 fen1]
